part1.converted_description:
You are given a list of integers representing the internal timers of lanternfish. Each lanternfish creates a new lanternfish once every 7 days. The internal timer of a lanternfish starts counting down after the current day. When the internal timer reaches 0, the lanternfish creates a new lanternfish with an internal timer of 8. On the next day, the internal timer of the new lanternfish starts counting down. Each day, a timer of 0 becomes 6 and adds an 8 to the end of the list, while each other timer decreases by 1. After a given number of days, you need to determine the total number of lanternfish.

Input Format:
The input is a comma-seperated list of integers representing the internal timers of lanternfish.

part2.converted_description:
Suppose the lanternfish live forever and have unlimited resources. After a given number of days, you need to determine the total number of lanternfish.

Input Format:
The input is a comma-seperated list of integers representing the internal timers of lanternfish.
